channel.title: Fitness
channel.description:
What do you do to stay fit, if anything at all?
If you weight lift, post your max lifts along with number of reps.

item.title: Fitness
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I might go to a gym, because I’m not motivated enough to work out at home. I quit after a few weeks, but if me or my parents pay for it I’ll go. But the gym close to my place has fitness/cardio, which I want to do, and fitness for 18- which is a group training. One thing I hate is group training… Oh well, I’ll see…

Read full topic

irl hacker.

item.title: Fitness
item.dc:creator: @NewAgeMovement NewAgeMovement
item.description:
@NewAgeMovement wrote:

The gym is far from here so i’m not going to the gym for only my upper body. For me, that would be a waste of time.
If i go the gym, i do a complete workout (wich includes running) and if i cant run, then i just dont go at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Fitness
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

[quote=“MastrChief, post:114, topic:205263”][quote author=Stork link=topic=270926.msg2242815#msg2242815 date=1211769901]
Not really, it’s more beneficial to do a warm up set before you start.
[/quote]

Obviously you’re going to do warm up sets before you do major lifting, but you jog or jumprope or something to get the blood pumping and to get your body ready.[/quote]
No, that’s what the warm up sets are for. No sense in doing both. You’ll just deplete stored glycogen you need for your workout.

Read full topic

item.title: Fitness
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

Stork:

Not really, it’s more beneficial to do a warm up set before you start.

Obviously you’re going to do warm up sets before you do major lifting, but you jog or jumprope or something to get the blood pumping and to get your body ready.

item.title: Fitness
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Fuck I hate coming back into training after shin splints. Today I had 10*200m @ 32 seconds with 2 mins recovery between and it hurt like a bitch.

Read full topic

item.description:

Stork we should totally bench together sometime and be like fitness friends, wowomg.

item.title: Fitness
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

exe626:

…Walking fast is better than running/jogging.

wut?

[quote=“Chimaera God, post:109, topic:205263”][quote author=Stork link=topic=270926.msg2242750#msg2242750 date=1211766984]
I gave up running since my lower body is almost always sore from weight training.
[/quote]

How much you squat/dead lift/clean at a time?[/quote]
Afraid I don’t squat (no rack available) or clean (no olympic rubber plates).
I deadlift 5x5 around 100kg [220lbs]. Nothing special, I’m working on my technique before I try and go for something heavier. Having troubles with slight rounding of the lower back, but I’ve nearly got it sorted

Read full topic

item.title: Fitness
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

[quote=“MastrChief, post:106, topic:205263”][quote author=Chimaera God link=topic=270926.msg2242387#msg2242387 date=1211752138]
Running is better to do AFTER strength training.
[/quote]

You can run to warm up your body before you get started with weight lifting, its good for you.[/quote]
Not really, it’s more beneficial to do a warm up set before you start.

Read full topic

item.title: Fitness
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

Stork:

Or better still, do it on days where you’re not strength training to prevent cortisol buildup…

^^^ Exactly. I run after I strength train and on my days off from the gym.

Read full topic

item.title: Fitness
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

[quote=“NewAgeMovement, post:100, topic:205263”][quote author=Stork link=topic=270926.msg2241999#msg2241999 date=1211732481]

People who train for posing are posers

True, but I’m training for strength at the moment, not for size…

Stork: Off-topic, but do you shave your arms?

Hair on my forearms is blond, so it doesn’t show up at all.

Why are shin splints stopping you from working out? Needs more dedication.
If you wanna look like you work out, you have to work out.

no shit?
Because whenever i go to the gym i have to warm up with running and after i train my upper body , then i start running again.
The doctor told me i should rest my feet for 2weeks, and without running there is no strenght training for me.

So the obvious solution is to not run until your legs heal and work out instead, instead of stopping both.
[/quote]
I just told you , without running there is no strenght training for me. I have to run first otherwise i would be too lazy and not enough motivated to do str training.[/quote]

Running is better to do AFTER strength training.

Read full topic

item.title: Fitness
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

NewAgeMovement:

I just told you , without running there is no strenght training for me. I have to run first otherwise i would be too lazy and not enough motivated to do str training.

Good luck getting big with an attitude like that.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork

[quote=“NewAgeMovement, post:98, topic:205263”][quote author=Stork link=topic=270926.msg2241191#msg2241191 date=1211691605]
Why are shin splints stopping you from working out? Needs more dedication.
If you wanna look like you work out, you have to work out.
[/quote]
no shit?
Because whenever i go to the gym i have to warm up with running and after i train my upper body , then i start running again.
The doctor told me i should rest my feet for 2weeks, and without running there is no strenght training for me.[/quote]
So the obvious solution is to not run until your legs heal and work out instead, instead of stopping both.

item.title: Fitness
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:94, topic:205263”]The easiest workout anybody could ever do: Wake up, eat a breakfast of a few eggs, do 40 sit-ups. Try your hardest to stay active about 3/5 of the day, eat lunch/dinner, do 40 more sit-ups before bed.

If you weigh 250lbs of fat, in 3 months of that^ with somewhat healthy foods, you could weigh 190-220 of pure muscle. In less than a year you’d have a 6pack.[/quote]
No you wouldn’t.
Unless you were like 6’8.

Read full topic
